page.title: 01Between Northchapel/Plaistow
page.content: Between Northchapel and Plaistow the Weald Clay has produced a wooded undulating landscape where forestry and farming predominate. The ancient Wealden forest has been opened up by settlers since prehistoric times. At Piper Copse are the remains of an Iron Age Camp. Shillinglee Furnace and Mitchell Park Forge are Tudor remnants of the iron industry. Today most of the woodland is managed by the forestry commission. Chiddinfold Forest is one of the earliest forests taken over by the commission in 1922. Kingspark Wood is an area of special scientific interest noted for butterflies, moths, flowers, mosses and liverworts. Farmland is mainly arable. There is also pastures for dairy cattle and sheep. The Ashpark Brickyard makes handmade bricks for high quality restoration work.
